Stop it, Sam! That's not nice! You can't shoot at God or a saint! That's very bad and rude!"
Sam did not understand. He thought it was just a game. He did not mean to hurt anyone.
"But it's just a toy gun," he said. "It doesn't do anything."
Tom shook his head.
"It doesn't matter. It's still wrong. You have to respect the temple and the people and the statues. They are here to teach us good things, not to play with. You have to say sorry and ask for forgiveness."

One day, a little boy named Tim saw an elderly lady. She was struggling to carry a big pie. Tim wanted to help her, but he was very small.
Tim thought hard. He knew he had to do something. He ran to a big tree and found a long stick. With the stick, he could help the elderly lady carry the pie.
Together, they carried the pie using the stick. It was not easy, but they did it. The elderly lady was so happy, she gave Tim a big piece of pie. They both smiled and enjoyed the yummy pie.

Once upon a time, there was a soldier. He was very thirsty. He wanted to find something to drink.
The soldier walked and walked until he found an open door. Inside, he saw a big cup. He thought, "This must be for me to drink!" He picked it up and took a big sip. But it was not water!
Suddenly, the soldier started to get small. He was now as small as a bug! The soldier was scared, but he knew he had to find a way to be big again.

"What's flammable?" Tom asked the man.
"Flammable means it can catch fire," the man replied. "That's why you have to be careful. Only use a little bit for your cars. And don't play with matches or lighters near it."
